FuncDef:
The nat-instance ip used-threshold command configures the upper limit and lower limit of an address segment in a global address pool.
The undo nat-instance ip used-threshold command restores the default configuration.
By default, the upper limit is 80% and the lower limit is 20% for an address segment in a global address pool.
CLIs: undo nat-instance ip used-threshold [ upper-limit <upper-value> lower-limit <lower-value> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Sets a lower threshold for address usage, which is used to apply for extended address segments in a global address pool.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 99, in percentage. The default value is 20.

Sets an upper threshold for address usage, which is used to apply for extended address segments in a global address pool.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 100, in percentage. The default value is 80. The upper limit must be greater than the lower limit.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When the address usage of the dynamic address pool of a NAT instance reaches the upper limit, extended address segments need to be requested from the global address pool. When the address usage of the dynamic address pool of a NAT instance falls below the lower limit, idle extended address segments need to be released from the global address pool.
Precautions
Using the default upper limit and lower limit of an address segment in a global address pool is recommended, and the difference between and must be over 60. For example, nat-instance ip used-threshold upper-limit 90 lower-limit 20.
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
This command is supported only by the admin-VS.
